summary: Create a single-page "Rose Day" website based on the provided HTML/CSS/JS (emoji rain + burst on click), with the same layout and styling.
architectural_notes: Static single-page site implemented with HTML/CSS/vanilla JS; includes animated emoji rain via DOM elements + CSS keyframes and click-triggered burst.

existing_features.title: Recreate the provided Rose Day page as the app’s main (single) page in the React + TypeScript frontend, matching the layout and content from the supplied HTML (hero rose emoji, card container, heading text, message paragraph with line breaks, and signature).

Match the provided styling in the React app (pink-to-white diagonal gradient background, Poppins-like sans-serif typography, centered layout, card sizing/padding/radius/shadow, and text styling). Implement the equivalent styles using Tailwind CSS and/or a dedicated stylesheet as appropriate.

Implement the emoji “rain” animation behavior from the provided JavaScript in React: continuously spawn falling emojis at a fixed interval, remove them after animation ends, and support a click/tap “burst” that spawns multiple emojis quickly. Use the same emoji set and similar timing and motion to the provided implementation.
Set the document/page title to “Rose Day” to match the provided HTML.
Add a clearly visible button on the Rose Day card that reveals (and can hide again) a special message when clicked/tapped.

new_feature_requests.summary: Build/deploy the Rose Day single-page website using the provided HTML/CSS/JS code (hero rose emoji, message card, emoji rain animation, click burst).
Add a button to the Rose Day page that reveals/displays a special message when clicked/tapped.
Deploy the updated Rose Day site so it is accessible via a shareable public URL.
